page.title: 11CLASS 1L's BOURNE WALK
page.content: Our class went for a walk around the Bourne area. We walked down Mavins road which used to be a field where the school treat used to be held with Mrs Anderson, who was the vicar's wife. The children who went on the treat went by cart and some walked. The church was terribly small and could seat roughly ten people. It has since fallen down, and a stone marks the spot where the altar used to be. All that remains is an overgrown graveyard and a lych-gate. This church was replaced by St. Thomas on the Bourne. We walked down Vicarage Hill to Paradise Woods past The Spotted Cow Pub and talked about how people used to make their own beer. Farnham used to be famous for its hops but they do not grow them any more.
